overview: Features deferred from initial workorder tracking implementation. These enhancements would build on the foundation of 1:1 workorder-to-plan relationship.

deferred_features.name: Multiple Workorders Per Plan
deferred_features.description: Allow a single plan to contain multiple workorders for complex features with distinct sub-features
deferred_features.use_case: Single plan file with WO-AUTH-001 (Login), WO-AUTH-002 (Registration), WO-AUTH-003 (Password Reset)
why_deferred: Adds complexity to validation and tracking
Most plans should stay focused (1:1 keeps plans manageable)
If feature is too large, better to split into multiple plan files
future_implementation: Update validator to handle multiple workorders
Update reporting to show progress across workorders within plan

deferred_features.name: Nested Workorders (Sub-Workorders)
deferred_features.description: Allow workorders to have sub-workorders for deeply hierarchical features
deferred_features.use_case: WO-AUTH-001 containing WO-AUTH-001-A (Login), WO-AUTH-001-B (Registration), WO-AUTH-001-C (Password Management)
why_deferred: Unclear if needed given 1:1 plan-to-workorder model
Can achieve similar organization with multiple flat workorders
future_implementation: Add parent_workorder_id field to workorder schema
Update validator for nested dependency validation
Add depth limit (e.g., max 2 levels deep)

deferred_features.name: Multi-Plan Progress Rollup
deferred_features.description: Track progress across multiple related plans as part of larger initiative
deferred_features.use_case: Project 'E-Commerce Platform' with auth-plan.json (100%), products-plan.json (60%), checkout-plan.json (0%) showing overall 53% complete
why_deferred: Need to define 'project' concept (group of plans)
future_implementation: Add project_id field to plan metadata
Project manifest file listing all related plans
Dashboard view showing all plans in project

deferred_features.name: Team Assignment Features
deferred_features.description: Assign workorders to specific team members or AI agents for collaboration
deferred_features.use_case: WO-AUTH-001 assigned to developer-1, status in_progress, with timestamps
why_deferred: Team features require user/agent identity system
future_implementation: Add workorder status transitions (pending → assigned → in_progress → review → complete)

deferred_features.name: Dependency Visualization
deferred_features.description: Generate visual dependency graphs showing workorder relationships
why_deferred: Textual dependency validation sufficient for MVP
Most plans have simple linear dependencies
future_implementation: Generate Mermaid/DOT graph from workorder dependencies

v2.0_high_priority: Multi-plan progress rollup (most requested by users)
v2.1_medium_priority: Multiple workorders per plan (if user feedback demands it)
v3.0_low_priority: Team assignment features (only if collaboration use case emerges)

decision_criteria.description: Before implementing any deferred feature, validate:

criteria.name: User demand
criteria.requirement: Has feature been requested by 3+ users?

criteria.name: Use case clarity
criteria.requirement: Do we have real-world examples where current approach fails?

criteria.name: Backward compatibility
criteria.requirement: Can it be added without breaking existing plans?

notes: If plans grow too large, guide users to create multiple focused plan files
Prioritize simplicity and ease of use over feature completeness
Let user feedback drive which enhancements to implement first
